title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping, heart-wrenching, and wholly remarkable tale of coming-of-age in a South poisoned by virulent prejudice.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by the Party, which has total control over every aspect of people's lives.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A portrait of the Jazz Age in all of its decadence and excess, capturing the spirit of the author's generation.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A groundbreaking narrative of humanity's creation and evolution that explores how biology and history have defined us.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Set on the desert planet Arrakis, Dune is the story of the boy Paul Atreides, heir to a noble family tasked with ruling an inhospitable world.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel about the adventures of hobbit Bilbo Baggins, who is hired by the wizard Gandalf as a burglar for a group of dwarves.

title: A Brief History of Time
author: Stephen Hawking
description: A landmark volume in science writing by one of the great minds of our time, exploring questions about the origin and evolution of the universe.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel of manners that depicts the emotional development of Elizabeth Bennet, who learns about the repercussions of hasty judgments.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel about a young Andalusian shepherd who travels to Egypt after having a recurring dream of finding treasure there.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: An exploration of the two systems that drive the way we thinkâ€”System 1 is fast, intuitive, and emotional; System 2 is slower, more deliberative, and more logical.
